name: Agile - Scrum
description: An iterative framework that structures development in fixed-length cycles called Sprints (typically 1-4 weeks). Emphasizes team collaboration, continuous feedback, adaptive planning, and delivering working software incrementally.
characteristics: Product Backlog prioritized by Product Owner
bestFor: Teams that can work in dedicated Sprints
Projects benefiting from regular stakeholder demos
notIdealFor: Highly regulated environments requiring extensive upfront documentation
Teams unable to commit to Sprint ceremonies

keyPractices.planning: Sprint Planning at start of each Sprint
keyPractices.requirements: User stories with acceptance criteria in Product Backlog
keyPractices.changeManagement: Changes incorporated in next Sprint, not mid-Sprint
keyPractices.testing: Continuous testing within Sprint, Definition of Done
keyPractices.documentation: Just enough documentation, working software priority

ceremonies.name: Sprint Planning
ceremonies.purpose: Define Sprint Goal and select backlog items

artifacts.name: Product Backlog
artifacts.description: Ordered list of everything needed in the product

artifacts.name: Sprint Backlog
artifacts.description: Items selected for the Sprint plus plan for delivery

artifacts.name: Increment
artifacts.description: Sum of all completed backlog items meeting Definition of Done
